Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel is at very convinient location the rooms were clean breakfast was poor (coffee and brioche) the only problem was that the rooms were no soundproof at all you could hear the people in the next room clearly

Reviews.Title: “Handy location at good price”
Reviews.Author: kefalotiri
Reviews.Content: A short walk from Termini Rail and Coach station which has direct link to FCO airport. Our room was on the 1st floor with double bed, bathroom with full bath, sink and bidet. FREE Wi Fi in the room. Hairdryer and safety deposit box. Constant hot water and radiators in the bedroom and bathroom. Breakfast available for 5 euro extra but we preferred the Fantasy Pizza Cafe a short walk away for a hearty low priced breakfast. Helpful staff gave us a map. No curfew as you have your own key with code. There was a fridge at reception where you could get cool drinks if you wanted. Vacate room 11:00 and leave your luggage by reception safely. We would go back there again at the rates we paid which were on special offer for February (when it snowed!). For airport transfer we used an airport shuttle service (driver with 7 passengers). Price was 15 euro per person airport to hotel. We booked the same driver to take us back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great price, comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: littlemissbeej
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel via LateRooms in January 2012 and got a really good deal compared to the price of other hotels in Rome. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from Termini station which was great. If you wanted to walk into the centre (Pantheon, Trevi Fountain area) it took about 20 minutes, but you could also get the metro from Termini if you wanted. There is a great little cafe just next door to the right as you come out of the hotel which did great Cappuccinos and pastries in the morning and cheap! The receptionist Lillian was really helpful, gave us a map and pointed out areas of interest. Our room was really cold so I asked for extra blankets and when we came back Lillian had got us a heater which we were so happy with. She was always willing and able to help us with any issues. The room was basic but clean, couldn't really fault anything for the price we paid. Security was good, you have codes to enter to get into the main door and the living area after hours. Overall, would recommend to people who don't want luxury but somewhere clean and comfortable to stay.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and helpful low budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn_travelling
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Termini (Rome's main train station) and therefore all other forms of transport and destinations, the hotel location is hard to beat. And despite the fact that train station areas are never the most pleasant nor quiet, Alexis is situated in a tranquil street with minimal noise. Our room was large and had character, and the bathroom in the corridor was very clean. Aside from the very budget friendly room rates that are hard to find in Rome, it was the friendliness of the reception staff that made our stay truly pleasurable. In every way they could help, they did so with a smile. And this, is priceless. Oh yes another very nice addition: good wifi at no extra cost!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angel L
Reviews.Content: The room did not have air conditioning. The attendants said that for 5 euros a night they could turn the air on. When we said ok, the attendant informed that in reality the a/c did not work. The hotel refused to fix the a/c, or provide a fan. We had to walk Rome with suitcases looking for a hotel after 10pm. The hotel then did not want to refund. We were misinformed and then charged. DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. NEXT DOOR AND ALSO CLOSE TO TERMINI THEIR IS ANOTHER HOTEL WITH A/C SECURITY AND BREAKFAST FOR LESS. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL...

Reviews.Title: “Good balance price-quality”
Reviews.Author: Cindy_Broeckaert
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome without any booking in advance. I was told it was risky and that Rome is fully booked in september. It is true. Once there, started looking for a place to stay and visited around 15 hotels, bed and breakfasts and guesthouses nearby Termini. Compared to what I saw in the other ones, the prices I heared, Alexis came out the best. Don't expect a hotel with silver cutlery, a breakfast-buffet and an elevator boy, for this kind of travelling you will need a slightly bigger budget in Rome. Hotel Alexis is a sympatethic hostel with friendly staff, rooms with character and a neat bathroom. Check out the cute little terrace on the first floor! Cis & Claire

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly economical hotel”
Reviews.Author: prrallen
Reviews.Content: We returned to this location after 10 years to find it brightly renovated and run by a very friendly, helpful team. The location, 5 minutes from Termini Station is fantastic. It's such good value for money. You are able to walk to most of the city's famous sights.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel of our whole vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Taryn77
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alexis was great! We had a shared bathroom which we shared with two other rooms. Both the room and the washroom were WAY bigger than I had expected, although the shower left a little bit to be desired. Everything was clean and nice. The staff were very friendly and the location can't be beat! Just a moments walk away from Termini train station which was great in the mornings to get to the metro for all the sights! There are quite a lot of stairs though and no elevator - so if you aren't able to climb steps then this probably isn't for you. But other than that I loved it and would recommend it to friends and family for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: cserme
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and although before arriving I had had some concerns because of the 2-star rating it turned out to be a very pleasant surprise. First of all, the location of the hotel is great, just 2 minutes from the Termini Train Station. When you enter you find the reception desk directly on your left. The decoration is perfect for a 2-star hotel, not very modern but doesn't seem old either. Our room was perfect. Small TV, as somebody else mentioned before in his comment, but who comes to Rome to watch TV? My only problem was that the soap in the bathroom was very liquid, they added a lot of water to it so we had to buy some. As for the service, the receptionist girl was incredibly friendly and sweet, she made us feel at home. Honestly, I prefer to stay at 2-star hotels with this kind of service than to go to a hotel with 200 rooms where you're just a small piece of a huge "factory" and they couldn't care less about you personally. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “A 1 star establishment, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: johno.franklin
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, Hotel Alexis again proves that finding a good hotel in Rome for a reasonable price is near impossible. This still is no excuse for the sub standard condition of the hotel. It is closer to a one star accommodation. Our room, per definition of size, was reasonable, but the bed was old and offered little support, the lighting was basic exposed bulbs (also in the bathroom) and the private toilet facilities basic. Bring your own soap and shampoo. There was a TV, although it was more for 'window dressing'. The location was at the end of a long and dark corridoor, leaving questions regarding fire safety (no illuminating exit signs along the way at all). The room was clean, given, but there was not much to clean. The old state of the furnishings and bedding does however mean you can hide a lot. The staff were competent and helpful where required, only we did witness fellow hotel guests being turned away from breakfast when they had arrived 5 minutes before it was said to close. We had to help argue for their case, and they were allowed to have breakfast afterall. On that note, although breakfast is included it is meager and very limited. Cordial drink, a small tart, and chocolate croissants in plastic wrappers with expiration dates leading into 3 years from now. The only positive thing I can say is the hotel was secure, and they did offer free wifi access throughout, although this is something becoming far more commonplace in all hotels and even b&bs. Hotel Alexis is a one star hotel. Although it's location is good, and the staff competent, it lacks basic management and investment in the rooms. I would not stay here again and would recommend others against staying also.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice at all”
Reviews.Author: Canuckconfucious
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of Rome but that is worth nothing because the hotel is not worth it's money. It is a hostel sold as a hotel. The rooms are filthy, it has bedbugs and this is one of the worst accompdationa you can book. Yes the front desk staff is helpful and nice but does that add any value if the rooms are cold and dirty .. No ! Our room was infested with invisible bedbugs and we scratched for two straight days. The linen is very dirty and underneath clean covers the pillows have yellow stains. The comforter has hair stuck on it and the beds are springy that sink in the middle with a lot of noise. I dis not have breakfast at all as it dis not look clean.I would not recommend this hotel at all and you are better off booking a hotel somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A simple life.”
Reviews.Author: Fisherman4x
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alexis does not offer a lot for a single traveler, however, what it lacks in luxury…it makes up for in goodwill. The staff was the utmost in friendliness and assistance with whatever my need was. The room was quite comfortable and well maintained daily. My accommodations shared a very large bathroom which was also cleaned daily. I was on the third floor and was very satisfied with the water pressure and the ability to get hot water was very prompt. The location gives you access to all the following within a couple of blocks…..grocery store, train/bus station (awesome), laundry mat, several restaurants from simple to the extreme. Tip: The hotel is in the center of the block and there is an awning that has the name Hotel Alexis.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Alexis
HotelInfo.Address: Via Gaeta 27, 00185 Rome, Italy
